You have an Azure subscription that contains an Azure Compute Gallery named Gallery1 and a virtual machine named Template1. Template1 has custom apps and settings configured.

You plan to deploy Azure Virtual Desktop session hosts by using a custom virtual machine image. The solution must meet the following requirements:

• The custom image must be stored in Gallery1.
• The custom image must be based on Template1.
• All new session hosts must have unique computer names and identifiers.

You need to create the custom image.

What should you do in the Azure portal?

choices.A: From Gallery1, create a new VM application definition.
choices.D: From Template1, capture a specialized virtual machine image.
choices.B: From Gallery1, create a new VM image definition.
choices.C: From Template1, capture a generalized virtual machine image.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
When you generalize a VM, it removes any specific computer names, identifiers, or other settings that would make it unique. This is typically done using a tool like Sysprep on a Windows VM. Once you've generalized the VM, you can create an image from it and store it in Gallery1. This image can then be used to deploy new session hosts in Azure Virtual Desktop.

Selected Answer: C
C. From Template1, capture a generalized virtual machine image.

Here’s why:

Generalized Image: Capturing a generalized image from Template1 ensures that the image can be used to create multiple session hosts with unique computer names and identifiers.
Storage in Gallery1: Once the image is generalized, you can store it in Azure Compute Gallery (Gallery1) and use it to deploy new session hosts.

Selected Answer: C
The correct answer is C. From Template1, capture a generalized virtual machine image.
This option:
Uses Template1 as the base for the custom image.
Allows the image to be stored in Gallery1 (as part of an image definition and version).
Ensures that new session hosts deployed from this image will have unique computer names and identifiers.
By capturing a generalized image, you're creating a reusable template that maintains the custom apps and settings from Template1 while allowing for the necessary uniqueness in new deployments, which is crucial for Azure Virtual Desktop session hosts.

Selected Answer: C
C. From Template1, capture a generalized virtual machine image.

Selected Answer: C

First action: Build a new VM named SH2 by using image version 0.0.1.
Why?
This ensures that SH2 is created using the specific image version (0.0.1) as required, enabling you to leverage the Azure Compute Gallery’s existing images.

Second action: From Pool1, deploy a new session host.
Why?
By deploying SH2 directly into Pool1 as a session host, the requirement of adding SH2 to the AVD host pool is being fulfilled, which minimizes additional administrative steps. This approach assumes that Azure Virtual Desktop agents will automatically be installed when the session host is added, eliminating the need for manual installation.

Reasoning:

Efficiency: Deploying directly from Pool1 ensures the new session host is seamlessly integrated into the existing environment.
